statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
Recently, Bob has been thinking about a math problem.
There are N Digits, each digit is between 0 and 9. You need to use this N Digits to constitute an Integer.
This Integer needs to satisfy the following conditions:
  • 1. must be an odd Integer.

  • 2. there is no leading zero.

  • 3. find the biggest one which is satisfied 1, 2.

Example:
There are three Digits: 0, 1, 3. It can constitute six number of Integers. Only "301", "103" is legal, while "130", "310", "013", "031" is illegal. The biggest one of odd Integer is "301".

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
There are multiple test cases. Please process till EOF.
Each case starts with a line containing an integer N ( 1 <= N <= 100 ).
The second line contains N Digits which indicate the digit $a_1, a_2, a_3, \cdots, a_n. ( 0 \leq a_i \leq 9)$.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: The output of each test case of a line. If you can constitute an Integer which is satisfied above conditions, please output the biggest one. Otherwise, output "-1" instead.
